info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 20 at 4:48PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN ELBERT AND SOUTHWESTERN ABBEVILLE COUNTIES THROUGH 515 PM EDT... At 448 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Elberton, or near Middleton, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Calhoun Falls, Nancy Hart State Park, Bobby Brown State Park, Middleton, Lake Strom Thurmond, Lake Russell, Russell State Park, Broad River Campground, Fortsonia, and Richard B Russell Dam. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
